column4: Im allocating drive space on my MSI wind... How do I keep windows 7 and install ubuntu 10.10?
im on the "allocate drive space" page
specifically, the "install ubuntu after windows" part: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WindowsDualBoot#Install Ubuntu after Windows
That page is nothing like what I am seeing
the process should be the same, the details might be a bit different.  Do you already have some unpartitioned space on your hdd?
I think it's all partitioned... Oh yeah it is... But sda4 looks empty... How will I know?
please pastebin the output of 'fdisk -l'  that tells fdisk to list partitions
Nvm... Can I see which partitions are safe to use by looking at the installation "allocate disk space"
I'll do fdisk -l once the demo opens lol
OK, that will show us how the partitions are set up right now.
Is it normal for the demo to freeze up after like 60 seconds?
Is there a way to get to the kernel with just USB in? Non installation?
There's a colorful bar with sda1, sda2, etc....
koo, so you understand what to do now?
Well I can overwrite a partion, but is that safe?
Should I shrink a partition and then make a new one?
